brief_description: To determine the effects of chronic immunosuppressive therapies on the magnitude and character of the adaptive immune response to influenza vaccination.
brief_title: Comparison of immune response to influenza vaccine in transplant patients and healthy controls
condition_studied: Assessment of influenza vaccine response administered 6 months post-renal transplant in patients receiving immunosuppressive treatments.
description: This is a prospective longitudinal study to determine the effects of chronic immunosuppressive therapies on the magnitude and character of the adaptive immune response to influenza vaccination in healthy controls compared to renal transplant patients.
endpoints:
1. HLA genotyping of enrolled subjects.
  2. FCM experiment to measure frequency and phenotypic profile of B and T cell subsets in chronically immunosuppressed patients.
  3. CD107A degranulation assay to assess numbers and function of antigen-specific memory T cells in chronic immunosuppression.
  4. CFSE proliferation assay to assess numbers and function of antigen-specific memory T cells in chronic immunosuppression.
  5. ELISPOT assay to assess memory B cell function in renal transplant patients with tacrolimus and sirolimus treatment.
  6. ELISA serum antibody titers to assess memory B cell function in renal transplant patients with tacrolimus and sirolimus treatment.
  7. Effects of chronic immunosuppression on dendritic cell function.
  8. Microarray experiment to define the transcriptional signatures associated with specific immunosuppressive regimens.
intervention_agent: tacrolimus-based or sirolimus-based immunosuppressants, influenza vaccine.
objectives:
1. To determine the effects of chronic immunosuppressive therapies on the magnitude and character of the adaptive immune response to influenza vaccination.
  2. To determine the effects of chronic immunosuppressive therapies on innate immunity during response to influenza vaccination.
  3. To define the transcriptional signatures after influenza vaccination with chronic immunosuppressive therapies.
official_title: Comparison of immune response to influenza vaccine in transplant patients and healthy controls
